our bold future vision
for the city for the next
30 years represents
the dawn of a new era
for the gold coast.




                                                      gold coast city council annual report 2008-09 1

                                                                                                                                                       community financial report................120
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  planning for
   our scorecard ..................................................ii
                                                                              chapter 5
                                                                                                                                                       financial statements ................................128                   our city's bold future
   our highlights ................................................ 1                                                                                                                                                              as the gold coast approached its 50th anniversary and its popu-
                                                                              our performance..................... 22                                chapter 8                                                                    lation approached 500,000, our bold future planning initiative
 chapter 2                                                                      5.1 our community................................... 24              legislative information                                                      represented a turning point in the history of both council and
 our city ...................................... 4                              5.2 our economy .......................................46                                                                                         the city.
                                                                                                                                                     and report indexes................ 150
   our city.............................................................. 4     5.3 our environment ................................64                 global reporting initiative                                                after decades of unprecedented growth and development, the
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  gold coast was at a critical point in its evolution.
   our city's bold future ................................... 6                 5.4 our governance.................................. 76                (gri) index....................................................162
   mayor’s report ............................................... 8                                                                                    legislative index ........................................163              with long-term planning the key to its future as a mature city, our
                                                                              chapter 6                                                                                                                                           bold future initiative, launched in 2007-08, aimed to ensure the
   ceo’s report ................................................... 9                                                                                  index ..............................................................164    gold coast’s social, environmental and economic sustainability
   celebrating our achivements ................. 10
                                                                              our business activities .......... 104                                   glossary ........................................................166       for the next 30 years.
                                                                                gold coast waste management
                                                                                                                                                       useful contacts ............................................ iv            now one of the most rapidly growing regions in australia, the
 chapter 3                                                                      statement of operations........................108
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  gold coast is one of the nation’s most desirable places to live, due
 our council .............................. 12                                  gold coast water statement of                                                                                                                     largely to its natural environment.
                                                                                operations ................................................... 114
   our councillors ............................................ 14                                                                                                                                                                the challenge facing the city – against a backdrop of changing
   democratic governance .......................... 16                                                                                                                                                                            economy, climate and resource availability – is to balance growth
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  with sustainability to ensure its liveability and its future prosperity.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  central to the bold future initiative was community consultation
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  to help create a vision for the city and then make it a reality.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  our bold future visioning project represents a big step forward
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  for council as it focuses on sharing responsibility with the com-
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  munity, enabling residents to contribute meaningfully to plan-
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  ning for the city’s future.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  it recognises that in the next 30 years there will be new and un-
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  known challenges, but that we will be best placed to meet these
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  by planning for an adaptable and flexible city by working with
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  the community.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  during 2007-08, more than 11,000 gold coast residents accepted
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  council’s invitation to help shape the future of their city, sharing
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  their views on how they would like to see it grow and develop
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  between now and 2040.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  through surveys, public forums and reference groups, the com-
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  munity consultation process identified residents’ key concerns,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  for the future of a city that is expected to grow to twice its current
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  size, and pinpointed their priorities.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  this led to the development of our corporate plan 2009-14, which
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  has been structured around six key focus areas to create the
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  framework for a city that: leads by example; is loved for its green,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  gold and blue; connects people and places; is safe and in which
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  everyone belongs; has a thriving economy and is shaped by
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  clever design.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  our corporate plan has been designed to deliver the first five
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  years of our bold future vision and forms the basis of our opera-
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  tional plan and annual budget. it will be reviewed and refreshed
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  periodically to ensure it remains focused on delivering our bold
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  future vision.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  active community participation will be an ongoing feature of our
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  bold future vision implementation as we monitor and report our
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  progress against the realisation of our bold future vision.




view from hot air balloon over the gold coast

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 gold coast city council annual report 2008-09 3



                                                                                                                                                                                               a golden jubilee for




2.0 our city
                                                                                                                     qld
                                                                                                                                                                                               gold coast city
                                                                                                                           gold                                                                as queensland celebrated its 150th anniversary in 2009, the year
                                                                                                  australia                coast                                                               also was an important milestone for the gold coast, marking its
                                                                                                                            city
                                                                                                                                                                                               golden jubilee.
                                                                                                                                                                                               proclaiming the city of the gold coast as a local authority area in
                                                                                                                                                                                               may, 1959, the queensland government recognised the promo-
                                                                                                                                                                                               tional value of the name adopted by the south coast town council
                                                                                                                                                                                               the previous year.
                                                                                                                                                                                               with its name coined during the economic boom of the post-war
                                                                                                                                                                                               period, the dynamic growth of the gold coast which has occurred
                                                                                                                                                                                               during the past 50 years shows no sign of slowing.
                                                                                                                                                                                               some 13,000 to 16,000 people move to the city each year. what
                                                                                                                                                                                               was once a series of seaside villages between coolangatta and
                                                                                                                                                                                               southport has become australia’s sixth largest city and one of its
                                                                                                                                                                                               fastest growing.
                                                                                                                                                                                               in spite of this development, the gold coast is one of australia’s
                                                                                                                                                                                               greenest cities, with public parklands and reserves covering about
                                                                                                                                                                                               half of its total area of 1400 km2.
                                                                                                                                                                                               the region retains much of its natural beauty and character and is
                                                                                                                                                                                               home to more than 604 native animal and 1672 native plant species,
                                                                                                                                                                                               in habitats ranging from coastal beaches and wetlands to mountain
                                                                                                                                                                                               rainforest.
                                                                                                                                                                                               the gold coast city boundary extends from the queensland–new
                                                                                                                                                                                               south wales border in the south, through to the albert and logan
                                                                                                                                                                                               rivers in the north, and from stradbroke island and coastal beaches
                                                                                                                                                                                               in the east to the hinterland escarpment in the west.
                                                                                                                                                                                               much of the area we know today as gold coast city forms part of
                                                                                                                                                                                               the traditional country of the yugambeh people, whose descen-


facts and figures
                                                                                                                                                                                               dants are among our city’s 500,000 residents.
                                                                                                                                                                                               while timber cutting and agriculture were responsible for the first
                                                                                                                                                                                               wave of development in the area, increasing recognition of the
                                                                                                                                                                                               region’s natural assets saw the emergence of tourism as an industry.
y population: 511,474                          y swimming pool complexes: seven                  y public bins emptied: 2110
                                                                                                                                                                                               in the early part of the 1900s, and with the advent of the motor ve-
y area: 1406 km2                               y swimming pools: 16 (including                   y public toilets maintained: 282                                                              hicle, burleigh heads, coolangatta, southport and elston (renamed
y rateable properties: 232,382                   four 50-metre pools)                                                                                                                          surfers paradise), became popular destinations for visitors.
  as at 30 june 2009                                                                             council-owned facilities
y budget approx. $1.312 billion                roads and paths                                   y council administration centres: two
                                                                                                                                                                                               as the gold coast marks its 50th year, and also looks ahead with
                                                                                                                                                                                               its bold future vision for the next 30 years, the city has reached a
y gold coast city council is                   y roads: 3139 km                                  y customer service branches: five
                                                                                                                                                                                               critical period in its evolution.
  australia’s second largest                   y bikeways: more than 600 km                      y libraries: 13
  council in population terms                  y paths and walkways: 923 km                                                                                                                    in conjunction with the community we are undertaking the long-

                                                                                                                                                                                                                      gold coast city council annual report 2008-09 11



                     introduction                                              representing the
                     the gold coast’s local government area is divided
                     into 14 divisions, (see below) each represented by an     community
                     elected councillor. the mayor is elected directly by      councillors represent the interests and needs of their community
                     voters across the city.                                   at the local level. while each councillor represents a division, the
                     councillors provide the most direct representation to     overall community interest is his or her ultimate consideration.
                     their communities. each brings an individual perspec-
                     tive to the decisions council must make on behalf of
                     the community. background information on each of          fulfilling their
                     the councillors, as well as his or her contact details
                     and office hours, is provided in the following pages.     obligations
                                                                               acceptance of the duties and responsibilities of the mayor and
                                                                               councillors is signified by their declaration of office. this requires the
                                                                               mayor and councillors to give a solemn undertaking that they will ful-
                                                                               fil the duties of office faithfully and impartially, according to the best
                                                                               of their judgment and ability. to represent the community effectively,
                                                                               councillors are required to attend regular meetings and to vote on all
                                                                               matters which require a decision. the role of councillors is defined
                                                                               by sections 229 and 230 of the local government act 1993. the ad-
                                                                               ditional roles of the mayor – including responsibility for the orderly
                                                                               conduct of council meetings, decision-making, and the exercise of
                                                                               mayoral powers and duties – are set out in section 231 of the act. the
                                                                               community also contributes to good governance by participating in
                                                                               council elections, involvement in community consultation programs,
                                                                               and informing councillors of relevant divisional issues.



                                                                               ensuring good
                                                                               government
                                                                               council’s authority is exercised as a whole, with decisions being
                                                                               made not by individual councillors but collectively when sitting as a
                                                                               council. in carrying out the responsibilities of public office, the mayor
                                                                               and councillors are bound by the local government act and the
                                                                               principles of good governance. as well as providing guidance to the
                                                                               mayor and councillors, the act provides for penalties – ranging from
                                                                               a written reprimand to disqualification from office – as safeguards
                                                                               against the misuse of power and authority.



                                                                               divisions
                                                                               division 1........21,771 enrolled voters
                                                                               division 2.......20,946 enrolled voters
                                                                               division 3....... 20,473 enrolled voters
                                                                               division 4....... 19,875 enrolled voters
                                                                               division 5.......20,565 enrolled voters
                                                                               division 6....... 19,083 enrolled voters
                                                                               division 7.......20,546 enrolled voters
                                                                               division 8.......20,563 enrolled voters
                                                                               division 9........20,912 enrolled voters
                                                                               division 10 ....20,257 enrolled voters
                                                                               division 11..... 21,255 enrolled voters
                                                                               division 12 .... 21,006 enrolled voters
                                                                               division 13 ....20,884 enrolled voters
                                                                               division 14 .....21,037 enrolled voters




3.0        our
           council                                                             photo: council’s surfers paradise administration building.

the local government act 2009 was assented to by parliament on 12        provided to, councillors                                                           section 534(1)(g)(i) and (iii) of the local government act 1993 requires
june 2009, with the act expected to become effective in 2009-10.         section 534(1)(g)(ii) of the local government act 1993 requires                    council to provide particulars of the total remuneration paid by it to
the act takes a principles-based approach to local government            council to provide particulars of the expenses incurred by, and the                each of its councillors, under the remuneration schedule, and the total
decision-making and governance, giving local authorities broad           facilities provided to, each of its councillors, under the expense                 superannuation contributions paid by it for each of its councillors dur-
scope to make choices about policies and processes relevant to           reimbursement policy during the year. the items are detailed in                    ing the year. these particulars are shown in the table below:

y independence of action by councillors, who must
  not place themselves under any financial obligation                    note: additionally, the mayor and councillors were provided with office accom-
  that may influence the way in which they carry out                     modation, office secretarial support, computers, an office telephone, related
  their duties and responsibilities as councillors                       tools-of-trade equipment and either a motor vehicle or motor vehicle allowance,
y appropriate use of information by councillors, who                     in accordance with the queensland public service benefit cost per year (assessed
  must not misuse, particularly for personal gain, any                   annual value). all amounts rounded to whole dollars.
  information received – which is not available to the
  general public – in the course of their duties
y transparency and scrutiny, which requires councillors
  to disclose their financial interests to ensure the
  confidence of the community in the integrity of local
  government decision-making processes, and
y appropriate use of entitlements by councillors,
  who must comply with local government policies
  regarding the use of their entitlements.


                                                                                                                                  p24


                                                                                            5.1 our community



                                                                                                                                  p46


                                                                                            5.2 our economy



                                                                                                                                  p64


                                                                                            5.3 our environment




5.0 our
              council’s operational planning process begins with a review of our



                                                                                                                                   p76
              achievements against the corporate plan 2005-09 and an assess-
              ment of how our activities have fulfilled our strategic objectives for
              a sustainable economy, environment and community.
              progress is measured both quantitatively and qualitatively against de-
              sired outcomes and performance measures for each of the 17 strategic
              priorities. this performance measuring and monitoring is the catalyst
              for continuous improvement in service delivery.
              it is important to note that many of our goals are beyond council’s
              direct control, although evaluating how our efforts contribute to
              community outcomes is a key input into future planning.




performance   photos: (from right, top) community event at broadbeach; fashion adds
              to the city’s economic mix; natural arch, springbrook; council chambers,
              surfers paradise.
              main photo: view south from q1 observation deck
                                                                                            5.4 our governance


                                                                                         gold coast city council annual report 2008-09 23

our performance // our community



cultural events supported                                                                                                                highlights
by council help to bring                                                                                                                 in partnership with members of the community and
the community together.                                                                                                                  state and federal government agencies, we are working
                                                                                                                                         to achieve the best possible outcomes for our city. the
                                                                                                                                         community will enjoy long-term benefits from many of our
                                                                                                                                         landmark achievements during 2008-09. these include:
                                                                                                                                         y securing $36 million in federal government funding
                                                                                                                                            for the development of an afl stadium at carrara
                                                                                                                                         y the substantial completion of the $42 million stage
                                                                                                                                            one of the southport broadwater parklands project,
                                                                                                                                            funded jointly by council and the state government
                                                                                                                                         y the planning scheme review, to develop an
                                                                                                                                            updated and simplified town plan, and
                                                                                                                                         y our continued collaboration with arts queensland with
                                                                                                                                            the a-venue youth music initiative, which encourages
                                                                                                                                            up-and-coming performers and entrepreneurs in the
                                                                                                                                            music industry, and supports our implementation of
                                                                                                                                            the gold coast cultural development strategy.


                                                                                                                                         addressing our
                                                                                                                                         challenges
                                                                                                                                         many of the challenges facing the gold coast stem from the
                                                                                                                                         rapid growth of its population which increases by 13,000 to
                                                                                                                                         16,000 each year. during 2008-09, we continued to work to:
                                                                                                                                         y create a safer city for residents and visitors
                                                                                                                                         y increase our share of state and federal government
                                                                                                                                           funding for infrastructure projects and service programs
                                                                                                                                         y involve residents in decision-making that affects
                                                                                                                                           the city’s future growth and development
                                                                                                                                         y provide the facilities and services to encourage community
                                                                                                                                           participation and an active and healthy lifestyle
                                                                                                                                         y help provide affordable housing
                                                                                                                                         y enhance the cultural life of the city
                                                                                                                                         y provide leading-edge library and information services
                                                                                                                                         y ensure a high standard of customer service, and




5.1                                                                   52%
                                                                                                                                         y improve access to facilities and services across the city.




                            our
                                                                                                                                         strategic priorities

$20 million
                                                                      what we mean
                                                                      by community
                                                                      we are committed to delivering the services and infrastruc-
                                                                      ture that provide members of our community with a sense
                                                                      of personal safety, well-being and belonging. opportunities
                                                                      for social interaction and cultural development, and input in
                                                                      council’s decision-making processes, encourage residents
                                                                      to participate fully in the life of the city.

       allocated by council for the $126 million stadium at carrara

5.1.4 customer service




strategic priority                             we are achieving high standards across a range of services we provide for residents, business
                                               operators and visitors to the city. new technology is playing an important role in the continu-
                                                                                                                                                 streamlining our systems                                                    5.1.4 key performance
responding to customers’
                                               ous improvement of our customer service, as we strive to find innovative ways to meet the
                                               needs of the community.
                                                                                                                                                 we will achieve further improvements in our level of customer ser-
                                                                                                                                                 vice and the efficiency of our operations across the organisation with      indicator (kpi)

our performance // our economy




                                                                                                                                   22%
                                                                                                                                                                                            highlights




5.2                        our
                                                                                                                                                                                            while tourism has provided the foundation for the gold coast’s
                                                                                                                                                                                            prosperity, and still contributes strongly to our economy, our
                                                                                                                                                                                            objective is to continue to work to broaden and strengthen the
                                                                                                                                                                                            city’s economic base. by investing in, and encouraging invest-
                                                                                                                                                                                            ment in, initiatives that enhance the economic development




                           economy
                                                                                                                                                                                            of the city, we are playing an important role in diversifying and
                                                                                                                                      increase in the number of                             strengthening the local economy. the city’s growth is being
                                                                                                                                                                                            underpinned by initiatives including:
                                                                                                                                  registered businesses in council's
                                                                                                                                                                                            y the implementation of the pimpama coomera
                                                                                                                                        key industry program                                  waterfuture masterplan – an innovative project
                                                                                                                                                                                              that has won international acclaim for helping to
                                                                                                                                                                                              drought-proof an entire gold coast community
                                                                                                                                                                                            y our centre improvement program, which is
                                                                                                                                                                                              driving the economic and social revitalisation
                                                                                                                                                                                              of the city’s business precincts
                                                                                                                                                                                            y the promotion of business at the southern end of
                                                                                                                                                                                              the city, through the allocation of $600,000 to the
                                                                                                                                                                                              connecting southern gold coast master plan program
                                                                                                                                                                                            y our $4 million road network improvement program, which
                                                                                                                                                                                              has targeted accident ‘black spots’ across the city, and
                                                                                                                                                                                            y the two-week tastes of gold coast festival, which
                                                                                                                                                                                              promotes the city’s growing reputation as a source
                                                                                                                                                                                              of fine food and wine, much of it grown locally.


                                                                                                                                                                                            addressing our
                                                                                                                                                                                            challenges
                                                                                                                                                                                            the global financial crisis has had an impact on the gold coast’s
                                                                                                                                                                                            signature industry, tourism, and on employment generally in
                                                                                                                                                                                            the region. to ensure the city continues to grow strongly and is
                                                                                                                                                                                            positioned to take advantage of the eventual economic upturn,
                                                                                                                                                                                            we have been working with industry and state and federal
                                                                                                                                                                                            government agencies to meet this challenge by:
                                                                                                                                                                                            y effectively integrating transport, land-use
                                                                                                                                                                                              planning and growth management
                                                                                                                                                                                            y continuing work on providing a reliable, affordable
                                                                                                                                                                                              and convenient public transport system
                                                                                                                                                                                            y maintaining the city’s road network
                                                                                                                                                                                              and improving traffic flows
                                                                                                                                                                                            y ensuring appropriate levels of funding for city
                                                                                                                                                                                              assets, and that these assets maximise social,
                                                                                                                                                                                              economic and environmental value
                                                                                                                                                                                            y delivering the necessary planning and infrastructure
                                                                                                                                                                                              to ensure the continuing development of
                                                                                                                                                                                              sustainable tourism within the city
                                                                                                                                                                                            y improving national and international connections, with a
                                 fashion represents a focus of industry development on the gold coast, and events such as                                                                     focus on trade, investment, education and tourism, and
                                  the national retail fashion awards draw visitors to the city, boosting the local economy.                                                                 y creating employment opportunities and assisting
                                                                                                                                                                                              local businesses to develop export markets.

                                                                                                                              by economy                                                    5.2.4 city image ............................................................................page 60
                                                                                                                              we are helping to create the climate for economic growth
                                                                                                                              by ensuring our city has the necessary infrastructure to
                                                                                                                              meet its current and future needs. by creating and pro-
                                                                                                                              moting a positive city image, and working with the com-
                                                                                                                              munity, industry and other levels of government, we are
                                                                                                                              expanding our city’s economic horizons beyond tourism.

5.2.3 diversify and
strengthen the economy




strategic priority                            our investment in improving the transport network will pay future dividends for the city,
                                              helping to drive the economic development of the gold coast. we are working with the state
                                                                                                                                                since making contact with business

our performance // our environment




natural arch, springbrook.
                                                                                                                                        highlights
                                                                                                                                        one of the fastest growing regions in australia, the gold coast is home
                                                                                                                                        to more than 490,000 residents. with bushland, marine and fresh-
                                                                                                                                        water habitats, the city also is one of the most biodiverse regions in
                                                                                                                                        the country, with more than 604 native animal and 1672 native plant
                                                                                                                                        species. during 2008-09, environmental initiatives that contributed to
                                                                                                                                        the quality of life of the city’s residents, as well as the preservation and




22%
                                                                                                                                        enhancement of the natural environment, included:
                                                                                                                                        y the development and implementation of a climate change
                                                                                                                                          strategy, incorporating council’s policy to achieve a carbon
                                                                                                                                          neutral operating environment by 2020, to address the
                                                                                                                                          impacts of greenhouse gas emissions on the city
                                                                                                                                        y a review of our 1998 nature conservation strategy, to
                                                                                                                                          define a viable conservation network for the city and
                                                                                                                                          ensure better delivery of nature conservation programs
increase in the extent of                                                                                                               y the upgrade of pump stations and the installation of
                                                                                                                                          new pipelines and pumps, to allow delivery of 20 million
vegetation protected and/or                                                                                                               litres of water daily to logan city, as part of the state
                                                                                                                                          government’s water amendment regulation, and
enhanced in the city since 2005                                                                                                         y council’s purchase of tipplers resort on south stradbroke
                                                                                                                                          island, funded by the open space preservation
                                                                                                                                          levy, to protect the island from over-development
                                                                                                                                          and to preserve it for future generations.


                                                                                                                                        addressing our
                                                                                                                                        challenges
                                                                                                                                        our rapidly growing population, and the threat of climate change,
                                                                                                                                        have the potential to adversely affect the city’s liveability, biodiver-
                                                                                                                                        sity and economy. during 2008-09 we continued to respond to these
                                                                                                                                        challenges by:
                                                                                                                                        y working with other levels of government to
                                                                                                                                          coordinate land use planning across the city
                                                                                                                                        y ensuring the planning scheme and local laws promote
                                                                                                                                          ecologically sustainable development and that new development
                                                                                                                                          integrates land use, transport, environmental and social planning
                                                                                                                                        y minimising the city’s ecological footprint for the benefit




5.3
                                                                                                                                          of current residents and future generations
                                                                                                                                        y retaining important ecosystems and protecting




                                   our
                                                                                                                                          and restoring significant wildlife habitats
                                                                                                                                        y ensuring the health of catchments, waterways and beaches, and
                                                                                                                                        y reducing energy consumption and meeting greenhouse
                                                                                                                                          gas emission reduction targets for council and the city.




                                   environment                                                                                          strategic priorities
                                                                                                                                        5.3.1 preserve and enhance the natural environment...............page 66

$78 million
                                                                           what we mean by
                                                                           environment
                                                                           we continue to strive to create and maintain a vibrant and
                                                                           sustainable city by balancing growth and environmental
                                                                           priorities. by working with the community, industry, and
                                                                           other levels of government, we are integrating land use
                                                                           and infrastructure as well as environmental, social and
                                                                           economic planning to preserve and enhance the city’s
                        will be spent on nature conservation initiatives   natural environment and its biodiversity.

5.3.2 key performance                                                            number of building and planning applications received

                                                                                the state government’s integrated planning act (ipa) provides the
indicator (kpi)                                                                 framework and timeframes for the assessment of development
                                                                                applications made to council. council assessment of applications
 degree of compliance with                                                     is necessary for a wide range of development undertakings. some
provisions in the planning scheme                                               development applications are extremely complex and may contain
                                                                                as many as 40 separate components – each with its own approval
 percentage of applications that met integrated                                processes and timeframes.
planning act (ipa) ‘make decision’ timeframes                                   we continue to work with all applicants to ensure we provide the
the state government’s integrated planning act (ipa) provides the               most timely service possible. it should be noted that the decrease
framework for the approval process for all development applications             in the number of development applications received will take some
made to council, whether by individuals or development companies.               time to be reflected in assessment turnaround times, due to the large
